abstract: Israeli ultra-Orthodox newspaper HaMevaser changes its front-page photograph of Paris unity rally to remove German Chancellor Angela Merkel and other female leaders; ultra-Orthodox publications usually do not publish pictures of women for reasons of modesty; some see omissions from Paris photograph as embarrassing and humorous.
lead_paragraph: The publication generally avoids running pictures of women for reasons of modesty, and its intended audience has been known to scratch female faces out of bus advertisements.

byline.contributor: Gabby Sobelman contributed reporting from Jerusalem, and Robert Mackey from New York.

snippet: The publication generally avoids running pictures of women for reasons of modesty, and its intended audience has been known to scratch female faces out of bus advertisements.

headline.main: Newspaper in Israel Scrubs Women From a Photo of Paris Unity Rally
headline.print_headline: Newspaper in Israel Scrubs Women From Photo of Paris Unity Rally
